snippet.textDisplay: If you play this game, be prepared to think out of the box. If the box really is there to begin with. Whatever it is, it's probably something MC Escher made. The bottom is probably located on three different sides simultaneously.
snippet.textOriginal: If you play this game, be prepared to think out of the box. If the box really is there to begin with. Whatever it is, it's probably something MC Escher made. The bottom is probably located on three different sides simultaneously.

snippet.textDisplay: One of my top games of all time. It is the game that anybody should play if they want to question what games should even be. Antichamber is to games, where philosophy is to life. Be prepared for lateral thinking.
snippet.textOriginal: One of my top games of all time. It is the game that anybody should play if they want to question what games should even be. Antichamber is to games, where philosophy is to life. Be prepared for lateral thinking.

snippet.textDisplay: I love how ambient this theme is.  You can just get lost in the puzzles and not even notice how great the music is.  I love the fact that some songs in the OST last like 15 to 30 minutes.

snippet.textDisplay: This .. this game. I loved it so much even after all the braindamage it did to me. the feelings it brought up and the loneliness i felt sometimes cannot compare to any other game. 10/10. Not to mention the very unique and abstract soundtrack still gets me drifting to another world.
snippet.textOriginal: This .. this game. I loved it so much even after all the braindamage it did to me. the feelings it brought up and the loneliness i felt sometimes cannot compare to any other game. 10/10. Not to mention the very unique and abstract soundtrack still gets me drifting to another world.

snippet.textDisplay: Step aside Portal 1/2, this is my favorite first person puzzle game and one of my favorite puzzle games of all time. I post this today because it's currently on sale on Steam. It may not have the Portal series' humor and slick presentation, but I prefer everything else. The puzzles made me think like rarely before in a video game and you get that perfect feeling of accomplishment when you succeed. The white/cold graphics mixed with the warm music made for a uniquely memorable audiovisual experience. It took about an hour for the game to completely click with me and for me to understand how it generally worked. One of the best things about this game is how open ended it is, if you're stumped on a certain puzzle you can simply come back to it later with a fresh mind and complete other puzzle rooms. The map lets you instantly teleport to any of the puzzle rooms you've visited. It's a good thing this tune is my favorite in the soundtrack as it's "only" 7 minutes long compared to the other 20+ minutes tunes. It's one of the most atmospheric and non-melodic tracks I've added to this list so far. With a good pair of headphones, it's a perfect music to relax and surf the web.
snippet.textOriginal: Step aside Portal 1/2, this is my favorite first person puzzle game and one of my favorite puzzle games of all time. I post this today because it's currently on sale on Steam. The white/cold graphics mixed with the warm music made for a uniquely memorable audiovisual experience. It took about an hour for the game to completely click with me and for me to understand how it generally worked. One of the best things about this game is how open ended it is, if you're stumped on a certain puzzle you can simply come back to it later with a fresh mind and complete other puzzle rooms. The map lets you instantly teleport to any of the puzzle rooms you've visited. snippet.textDisplay: @MrTrojanic Yeeah, quite puzzling; I've been running in circles for hours...
snippet.textOriginal: @MrTrojanic Yeeah, quite puzzling; I've been running in circles for hours...

snippet.textDisplay:
@Mdude360 I would certainly recommend picking up all 3 if you enjoy puzzle games but I wouldn't compare this game to Portal at all.

Portal had a sense of humor and a very straight forward plot. In the end it was a game with puzzle aspects that still needed to hold up with industry standards whereas Anti-Chamber isn't any of those things. It is it's own contraption and unlike anything I've played before. The puzzles are a lot more difficult as I believe the game was designed to fit around the puzzles (rather than the puzzles designed to fit into the game) and it has the ability to change the way that you think.
